required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of SGN1 Administered Via Intratumoral Injection in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumor
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, Open-label, Dose Escalation and Dose-Expansion Study to Evaluate the Safety and Tolerability of Modified Salmonella Typhimurium SGN1 Administered Via Intratumoral Injection in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock:
Objectives：To characterize safety, tolerability, MTD and RP2D, PK, biological distribution, immunogenicity, and preliminary efficacy of intratumoral injection of SGN1 in patients with advanced solid tumors.
Study Rationale:The mechanism of action for SGN1 is based on the fact that most tumors are methionine dependent. SGN1 is designed to be used as a tumor therapeutic bacterium that can preferentially replicate and accumulate in tumors and starve them of essential amino acids by delivering the oncolytic enzyme L-Methioninase.
Patient Population:Patients with advanced head and neck squamous cell carcinoma(HNSCC), who have disease progression after receiving at least one standard systemic treatment in the past, or who are intolerant to or unable to receive the curative or life-prolonging standard of care available therapies. Patients should have target lesions suitable for intratumoral injection of SGN1.

detailed_description.textblock:
Methionine starvation can powerfully modulate DNA methylation, cell cycle transition, polyamines and antioxidant synthesis of tumor cells, in contrast to normal ones. L-Methioninase is a pyridoxal phosphate dependent enzyme that catalyzes the γ-elimination reaction of L-methionine to methanethiol, α-ketobutyrate and ammonia . Absolute-dependency on exogenous supply of L-methionine, not homocysteine, for growth and proliferation of tumors is the pivotal biochemical criterion for various human cancers.
SGN1 is a genetically modified strain of Salmonella enterica, serotype typhimurium (VNP20009-M) that expresses L-Methioninase. The attenuated live bacterium has been investigated in China for utility in treating advanced solid tumors. The mechanism of action for SGN1 is based on the fact that most tumors are methionine dependent. SGN1 is designed to be used as a tumor therapeutic bacterium that can preferentially replicate and accumulate in tumors and starve them of essential amino acids by delivering the oncolytic enzyme L-Methioninase.
This study will be conducted in 3 parts: dose escalation study, MTD expansion study and specific tumor type expansion study. All parts of the trial will consist of a screening period of up to 28 days, a treatment period and a safety follow-up period and a long-term survival follow-up period.The standard 3+3 dose escalation algorithm will be applied to explore dose limiting toxicity (DLTs) in up to 5 sequential cohorts with 3-6 patients and identify the maximally tolerated dose (MTD).Upon completion of all three 28-day observation periods, if there are no (0) DLTs over 28 days as determined by the SMC, the 3 participants may enter the repeated dosing period to receive SGN1 in 28-days cycles (once weekly for 3 weeks followed by 1-week rest). Simultaneously, 3 new participants may be enrolled in the next higher dose level.
To further evaluate the safety and efficacy of SGN1, the MTD identified in Part 1 will be expanded with additional 10 to 12 subjects with advanced solid tumors. All subjects will receive SGN1 once every week for 3 weeks followed by 1 week rest in 28-day cycles for up to 4 months, withdrawal of consent, disease progression or occurrence of any intolerable toxicity, whichever occurs first.
After an SGN1 dose for further investigation is established, enrollment of several expansion cohorts will be opened to determine the safety and efficacy of SGN1 in specific tumor types with potential efficacy signal observed in the previous dose escalation and MTD expansion study.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This study will be conducted in 3 parts: Part 1 is an open-label, dose escalation study.Part 2 is an open-label, MTD expansion study.Part 3 is an open-label, specific tumor-type expansion study. All parts of the trial will consist of a screening period of up to 28 days, a treatment period and a follow-up period. The standard 3 + 3 dose escalation algorithm will be applied to explore dose limiting toxicity (DLTs) in up to 5 sequential cohorts with 3- 6 patients and identify the maximally tolerated dose (MTD). To further evaluate the safety and efficacy of SGN1, the MTD identified in Part 1 will be expanded with additional subjects with advanced solid tumors. After an SGN1 dose for further investigation is established, enrollment of several expansion cohorts will be opened to determine the safety and efficacy of SGN1 in specific tumor types with potential efficacy signal observed in the previous dose escalation and MTD expansion study.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence and severity of adverse events (AEs) and serious adverse events (SAEs).
primary_outcome.time_frame: From signing the informed consent form until 30 days after the last dose
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the safety and tolerability of local injection of SGN1 in patients with advanced solid tumors

primary_outcome.measure: Dose limiting toxicities (DLT)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Upon completion of a 28-day observation periods after administration.
primary_outcome.description: Any Grade 5 adverse event that is at least possibly related to investigational drug Grade 4 non-hematological toxicities (excluding alopecia) of any duration Grade 4 hypotension, hypoxia, fever and acute respiratory distress of any duration Grade 3 non-hematologic (non-laboratory) toxicity lasting 7 days despite optimal supportive care • Any Grade 3 or Grade 4 non-hematologic laboratory value if: a) medical intervention is required to treat the patient; b) the abnormality leads to hospitalization; c) the abnormality persists for 7 days Grade 4 hematologic toxicity, other than those specified in criteria 5 and 6 below, lasting longer than 7 days Grade 3 or Grade 4 febrile neutropenia of any duration Grade 3 thrombocytopenia in combination with a Grade 3 or greater blood and lymphatic system disorder Grade 3 AST or ALT that is associated with a Grade 2 or greater rise in bilirubin

primary_outcome.measure: peak plasma concentration (Cmax) in the dose escalation study.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 0.5 hours before single dose administration on Day 1, and at 10 minutes , 2 hours , 4 hours, 6 hours, 12 hours after the end of the administration, Day 2 , Day 3 , Day 4,Day 8 and Day 15
primary_outcome.description: Blood will be collected to analyze and describe the PK profile of SGN1.

primary_outcome.measure: time to maximum concentration (Tmax) in the dose escalation study.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 0.5 hours before single dose administration on Day 1, and at 10 minutes , 2 hours , 4 hours, 6 hours, 12 hours after the end of the administration, Day 2 , Day 3 , Day 4,Day 8 and Day 15
primary_outcome.description: Blood will be collected to analyze and describe the PK profile of SGN1.

primary_outcome.measure: elimination half-life (T1/2) in the dose escalation study.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 0.5 hours before single dose administration on Day 1, and at 10 minutes , 2 hours , 4 hours, 6 hours, 12 hours after the end of the administration, Day 2 , Day 3 , Day 4,Day 8 and Day 15
primary_outcome.description: Blood will be collected to analyze and describe the PK profile of SGN1.

primary_outcome.measure: area under the plasma concentration-time curve in the selected time interval (AUC0-t) in the dose escalation study.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 0.5 hours before single dose administration on Day 1, and at 10 minutes , 2 hours , 4 hours, 6 hours, 12 hours after the end of the administration, Day 2 , Day 3 , Day 4,Day 8 and Day 15
primary_outcome.description: Blood will be collected to analyze and describe the PK profile of SGN1.

primary_outcome.measure: area under the plasma concentration-time curve in the interval from 0 to infinity (AUC0-∞)in the dose escalation study.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 0.5 hours before single dose administration on Day 1, and at 10 minutes , 2 hours , 4 hours, 6 hours, 12 hours after the end of the administration, Day 2 , Day 3 , Day 4,Day 8 and Day 15
primary_outcome.description: Blood will be collected to analyze and describe the PK profile of SGN1.

primary_outcome.measure: apparent clearance (CL/F)in the dose escalation study.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 0.5 hours before single dose administration on Day 1, and at 10 minutes , 2 hours , 4 hours, 6 hours, 12 hours after the end of the administration, Day 2 , Day 3 , Day 4,Day 8 and Day 15
primary_outcome.description: Blood will be collected to analyze and describe the PK profile of SGN1.

primary_outcome.measure: apparent volume of distribution of the terminal phase (Vz/F) in the dose escalation study.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 0.5 hours before single dose administration on Day 1, and at 10 minutes , 2 hours , 4 hours, 6 hours, 12 hours after the end of the administration, Day 2 , Day 3 , Day 4,Day 8 and Day 15
primary_outcome.description: Blood will be collected to analyze and describe the PK profile of SGN1.

primary_outcome.measure: mean residence time (MRT) in the dose escalation study.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 0.5 hours before single dose administration on Day 1, and at 10 minutes , 2 hours , 4 hours, 6 hours, 12 hours after the end of the administration, Day 2 , Day 3 , Day 4,Day 8 and Day 15
primary_outcome.description: Blood will be collected to analyze and describe the PK profile of SGN1.

primary_outcome.measure: peak concentration at steady state(Cmax, ss) in the MTD expansion study.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 8, and Day 15 of the first cycle: before administration and at 10 minutes, 2 hours and 6 hours after the end of administration.
primary_outcome.description: Blood will be collected to analyze and describe the PK profile of SGN1.

primary_outcome.measure: time to maximum concentration at steady state (Tmax, ss) in the MTD expansion study.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 8, and Day 15 of the first cycle: before administration and at 10 minutes, 2 hours and 6 hours after the end of administration.
primary_outcome.description: Blood will be collected to analyze and describe the PK profile of SGN1.

primary_outcome.measure: average plasma concentration at steady state (Cav, ss) in the MTD expansion study.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 8, and Day 15 of the first cycle(each cycle is 28 days): before administration and at 10 minutes, 2 hours and 6 hours after the end of administration.
primary_outcome.description: Blood will be collected to analyze and describe the PK profile of SGN1.

primary_outcome.measure: area under the plasma concentration time curve at steady state (AUC0-t, ss) in the MTD expansion study.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 8, and Day 15 of the first cycle(each cycle is 28 days): before administration and at 10 minutes, 2 hours and 6 hours after the end of administration.
primary_outcome.description: Blood will be collected to analyze and describe the PK profile of SGN1.

primary_outcome.measure: apparent clearance at steady state (CLss/F) in the MTD expansion study.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 8, and Day 15 of the first cycle(each cycle is 28 days): before administration and at 10 minutes, 2 hours and 6 hours after the end of administration.
primary_outcome.description: Blood will be collected to analyze and describe the PK profile of SGN1.

primary_outcome.measure: accumulation index (RAUC) in the MTD expansion study.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 8, and Day 15 of the first cycle(each cycle is 28 days): before administration and at 10 minutes, 2 hours and 6 hours after the end of administration.
primary_outcome.description: Blood will be collected to analyze and describe the PK profile of SGN1.

primary_outcome.measure: plasma trough concentration (Cmin) in the MTD expansion study.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 8, and Day 15 of the first cycle(each cycle is 28 days): before administration and at 10 minutes, 2 hours and 6 hours after the end of administration.
primary_outcome.description: Blood will be collected to analyze and describe the PK profile of SGN1.

primary_outcome.measure: fluctuation index (FD) in the MTD expansion study.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 8, and Day 15 of the first cycle(each cycle is 28 days): before administration and at 10 minutes, 2 hours and 6 hours after the end of administration.
primary_outcome.description: Blood will be collected to analyze and describe the PK profile of SGN1.

primary_outcome.measure: Best overall response (BOR)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From signing the informed consent form until 30 days after the last dose.
primary_outcome.description: To preliminarily evaluate the anti-tumor efficacy of local injection of SGN1 in patients with advanced malignant solid tumors.

primary_outcome.measure: Disease control rate (DCR)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From signing the informed consent form until 30 days after the last dose.
primary_outcome.description: To preliminarily evaluate the anti-tumor efficacy of local injection of SGN1 in patients with advanced malignant solid tumors.

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical benefit rate (CBR)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From signing the informed consent form until 30 days after the last dose.
primary_outcome.description: To preliminarily evaluate the anti-tumor efficacy of local injection of SGN1 in patients with advanced malignant solid tumors.

primary_outcome.measure: Progression-free survival (PFS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From signing the informed consent form until 30 days after the last dose.
primary_outcome.description: To preliminarily evaluate the anti-tumor efficacy of local injection of SGN1 in patients with advanced malignant solid tumors.

primary_outcome.measure: Duration of remission (DOR)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From signing the informed consent form until 30 days after the last dose.
primary_outcome.description: To preliminarily evaluate the anti-tumor efficacy of local injection of SGN1 in patients with advanced malignant solid tumors.

primary_outcome.measure: Overall survival (OS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From signing the informed consent form until 30 days after the last dose.
primary_outcome.description: To preliminarily evaluate the anti-tumor efficacy of local injection of SGN1 in patients with advanced malignant solid tumors.

secondary_outcome.measure: Biodistribution/shedding of SGN1 in the dose escalation study.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after the last dose.
secondary_outcome.description: SGN1 in blood, urine, feces, and liquefied tumor tissue (if possible).Biodistribution of SGN1 will be determined in Part 1

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity test (ADA) in the dose escalation study.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after the last dose.
secondary_outcome.description: Anti-drug antibody (ADA) blood samples should be collected from all subjects. The blood collection time points of the subjects participating in the dose escalation and MTD expansion studies

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity test (ADA) in the MTD expansion study.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to the 85th day after the first administration
secondary_outcome.description: Anti-drug antibody (ADA) blood samples should be collected from all subjects. The blood collection time points of the subjects participating in the dose escalation and MTD expansion studies

secondary_outcome.measure: CD8+T signal activity in the dose escalation study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after the last dose.
secondary_outcome.description: To explore the relationship between the corresponding marker and the treatment by collecting blood and/or tissue samples.

secondary_outcome.measure: serum methionine level in plasma and/or tumor tissue in the dose escalation study.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after the last dose.
secondary_outcome.description: To explore the relationship between the corresponding marker and the treatment by collecting blood and/or tissue samples.

secondary_outcome.measure: CD8+T signal activity in the MTD expansion study.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 8 and Day 15 of the first cycle(each cycle is 28 days)
secondary_outcome.description: To explore the relationship between the corresponding marker and the treatment by collecting blood and/or tissue samples.

secondary_outcome.measure: serum methionine level in plasma and/or tumor tissue in the MTD expansion study.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 8 and Day 15 of the first cycle(each cycle is 28 days)
secondary_outcome.description: To explore the relationship between the corresponding marker and the treatment by collecting blood and/or tissue samples.

arm_group.description: The standard 3 + 3 dose escalation algorithm will be applied to explore dose limiting toxicity (DLTs) in up to 5 sequential cohorts with 3- 6 patients and identify the maximally tolerated dose (MTD). To further evaluate the safety and efficacy of SGN1, the MTD identified in Part 1 will be expanded with additional subjects with advanced solid tumors. After an SGN1 dose for further investigation is established, enrollment of several expansion cohorts will be opened to determine the safety and efficacy of SGN1 in specific tumor types with potential efficacy signal observed in the previous dose escalation and MTD expansion study.

intervention.description: SGN1,will be administered intratumorally,which dosage is 0.9-2.0×109 cfu /vial.
